content.question: Let <math alttext="f " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the cosine of, open parenthesis, x squared, plus x, close parenthesis, plus 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The derivative of <math alttext="f " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, negative, open parenthesis, 2 x, plus 1, close parenthesis, times the sine of, open parenthesis, x squared, plus x, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. What value of <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> satisfies the conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem applied to <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 2, close bracket " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: 1.079 because <math alttext="f of 1.079, equals, the fraction with numerator f of 2, minus f of 1, and denominator 2 minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.079</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

1.438 because <math alttext="f prime of 1.438, equals, the fraction with numerator f of 2, minus f of 1, and denominator 2 minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.438</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

1.750 because <math alttext="f double prime of 1.750, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.750</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

1.932 because <math alttext="f prime of 1.932, equals, f of 1.932" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.932</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1.932</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: 1.438 because <math alttext="f prime of 1.438, equals, the fraction with numerator f of 2, minus f of 1, and denominator 2 minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.438</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
